block.p: The pervasive abuse of women is compounding AIDS in some of the poorest countries of southern Africa and South Asia, a Unicef survey reported. The study suggests that between a fifth and a half of women and girls around the world may suffer abuse during their lives, from their birth to battering later in life. Unable to resist sexual advances by family members, girls and women become vulnerable to disease, including AIDS, which is now infecting more women than men in Africa.
